articles.title: Australia's COVID-19 vaccine rollout keeps GPs at the centre, but dose supply remains an issue - ABC News
articles.description: A GP clinic in Melbourne set up a self-funded mass vaccination clinic in an empty retail space, next door. It was full on the first day, but now it's barely being used.
articles.content:
Melbourne doctor Shea Wilcox estimates he could be vaccinating at least 200 people a day but, instead, the mass vaccination clinic he set up himself sits empty most of the time.

articles.title: Scott Morrison inches Australia towards 2050 net zero emissions, but distances himself from 'inner city' types - ABC News
